verses.text: Unto \w the|strong="H8199"\w* end, \w for|strong="H0430"\w* \w the|strong="H8199"\w* sons \w of|strong="H0376"\w* Core, \w to|strong="H0376"\w* give understanding.

\w We|strong="H3588"\w* \w have|strong="H0859"\w* \w heard|strong="H3588"\w*, \w O|strong="H0859"\w* \w God|strong="H0430"\w*, \w with|strong="H1980"\w* \w our|strong="H0430"\w* ears: \w our|strong="H0430"\w* fathers \w have|strong="H0859"\w* declared \w to|strong="H1980"\w* \w us|strong="H3588"\w*, \w The|strong="H3588"\w* work, thou hast wrought \w in|strong="H1980"\w* \w their|strong="H3588"\w* days, \w and|strong="H1980"\w* \w in|strong="H1980"\w* \w the|strong="H3588"\w* days \w of|strong="H0430"\w* old.

Thy hand destroyed \w the|strong="H0413"\w* Gentiles, \w and|strong="H0935"\w* thou plantedst \w them|strong="H0413"\w*: thou didst afflict \w the|strong="H0413"\w* people \w and|strong="H0935"\w* \w cast|strong="H7971"\w* \w them|strong="H0413"\w* \w out|strong="H7971"\w*.

\w For|strong="H0413"\w* \w they|strong="H0935"\w* got not \w the|strong="H0413"\w* possession \w of|strong="H0430"\w* \w the|strong="H0413"\w* land \w by|strong="H0413"\w* \w their|strong="H0935"\w* own sword: neither did \w their|strong="H0935"\w* own arm save \w them|strong="H0413"\w*. \w But|strong="H0935"\w* thy right hand \w and|strong="H0935"\w* thy arm, \w and|strong="H0935"\w* \w the|strong="H0413"\w* light \w of|strong="H0430"\w* thy countenance: \w because|strong="H0413"\w* thou wast pleased \w with|strong="H0413"\w* \w them|strong="H0413"\w*.

Thou art thyself \w my|strong="H5921"\w* \w king|strong="H5921"\w* \w and|strong="H0430"\w* \w my|strong="H5921"\w* \w God|strong="H0430"\w*, \w who|strong="H5315"\w* commandest \w the|strong="H6440"\w* \w saving|strong="H3444"\w* \w of|strong="H0430"\w* Jacob.
Through thee we will push down our enemies with the horn: and through thy name we will despise them that rise up against us.
For I will not trust in my bow: neither shall my sword save me.
But thou hast saved us from them that afflict us: and hast put them to shame that hate us.
In God shall we glory all the day long: and in thy name we will give praise for ever.
But now thou hast cast us off, and put us to shame: and thou, O God, wilt not go out with our armies.
Thou hast made us turn our back to our enemies: and they that hated us plundered for themselves.
Thou hast given us up like sheep to be eaten: thou hast scattered us among the nations.
Thou hast sold thy people for no price: and there was no reckoning in the exchange of them.
Thou hast made us a reproach to our neighbours, a scoff and derision to them that are round about us.
Thou hast made us a byword among the Gentiles: a shaking of the head among the people.
All the day long my shame is before me: and the confusion of my face hath covered me,
At the voice of him that reproacheth and detracteth me: at the face of the enemy and persecutor.
All these things have come upon us, yet we have not forgotten thee: and we have not done wickedly in they covenant.
And our heart hath not turned back: neither hast thou turned aside our steps from thy way.
For thou hast humbled us in the place of affliction: and the shadow of death hath covered us.
If we have forgotten the name of our God, and if we have spread forth our hands to a strange god:
Shall not God search out these things: for he knoweth the secrets of the heart. Because for thy sake we are killed all the day long: we are counted as sheep for the slaughter.
Arise, why sleepest thou, O Lord? arise, and cast us not off to the end.
Why turnest thou face away? and forgettest our want and our trouble?
For our soul is humbled down to the dust: our belly cleaveth to the earth.
Arise, O Lord, help us and redeem us for thy nameâ€™s sake.
